alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 1:41AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cook and northeastern Lake Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 141 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, to 6 miles southeast of Little Saganaga Lake, to 8 miles north of Lutsen, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Alpine Lake around 145 AM CDT. Saganaga Lake around 150 AM CDT. Gunflint Lake and Sea Gull Lake around 155 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Brule Lake, Cherokee Lake, Cascade Lake, Poplar Lake, Daniels Lake, Knife Lake, North Lake, Gabimichigami Lake, Tail Lake and Crescent Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore
